definition[0]: of a good enough standard or quality
example[1]: Don’t you have a decent jacket?
example[2]: a house with a decent-sized yard
example[3]: Their in-flight magazine is halfway decent (=quite good).
definition[1]: following moral standards that are acceptable to society
example[5]: Paul visited the local bars more frequently than was decent for a senior lecturer.
example[6]: The chairman did the decent thing (=did what people thought he ought to) and resigned.
example[7]: The majority of residents here are decent citizens.
definition[2]: treating people in a fair and kind way
example[8]: I decided her father was a decent guy after all.
example[9]: It was decent of you to show up today.
definition[3]: wearing enough clothes so that you do not show too much of your body – used humorously
example[10]: Are you decent? Can I come in?
